stateWideResources.name: 2-1-1 Arizona
stateWideResources.description: 2-1-1 Arizona is a comprehensive information and referral service that connects individuals and families to over 8,500 local and statewide resources. The service helps people find assistance with basic needs, housing, utilities, food, healthcare, employment, and other essential services.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: Dial 2-1-1 within Arizona | 877-211-8661 from anywhere | Fax: 602-263-0979 | Arizona Relay: 7-1-1 or 800-367-8939 | Address: 1275 W. Washington St. Suite 210, Tempe, AZ 85288
stateWideResources.notes: Available by phone from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. Monday through Friday. Website search available 24/7. Cannot help people in person at their office.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV)
stateWideResources.description: A statewide coalition that provides support, resources, and advocacy for victims of sexual and domestic violence across Arizona. They operate a 24/7 helpline and connect survivors with local services.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 602-279-2980 or 1-800-782-6400 (Arizona Sexual and Domestic Violence Helpline) | Email: Contact through website form | Address: Phoenix, Arizona (serves statewide)
stateWideResources.phone: 602-279-2980 or 1-800-782-6400 (Arizona Sexual and Domestic Violence Helpline)
stateWideResources.eligibility: Victims of sexual and domestic violence in Arizona
stateWideResources.hours: 24/7 helpline; Office hours by appointment only
services: Connection to local domestic violence programs

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV)
stateWideResources.description: A statewide coalition providing support, resources, and advocacy for victims of sexual and domestic violence across Arizona. They operate the Arizona Sexual and Domestic Violence Helpline, offering multiple ways to connect with support services.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 602-279-2900 (Office), 800-782-6400 (Helpline) | Email: info@acesdv.org | Address: 2800 N. Central Ave., Suite 1570, Phoenix, AZ 85004
stateWideResources.address: 2800 N. Central Ave., Suite 1570, Phoenix, AZ 85004
stateWideResources.eligibility: Anyone affected by sexual or domestic violence in Arizona
stateWideResources.hours: Helpline: Mon 8:30-5, Tues 8:30-7, Wed-Fri 8:30-5; Office hours may vary
services: Referrals to local programs and shelters

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV)
stateWideResources.description: Statewide coalition providing support and resources for sexual and domestic violence survivors through helpline services, local program connections, and resources.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Survivors of sexual and domestic violence

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security
stateWideResources.description: State agency providing various assistance programs
stateWideResources.notes: Distance to service centers creates access barriers

stateWideResources.name: 211 Arizona
stateWideResources.notes: Phone-based service helps overcome geographic barriers

stateWideResources.name: Wildfire Arizona
stateWideResources.notes: Limited direct services in remote areas

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security Homeless Services
stateWideResources.description: A state agency that coordinates homeless services through federal and state funds, contracting with nonprofit and local government entities to provide rapid rehousing, emergency shelter, homeless prevention, and street outreach services throughout Arizona.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing a housing crisis in Arizona

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Health Care Cost Containment System (AHCCCS)
stateWideResources.description: Arizona's Medicaid agency that offers health care programs to serve Arizona residents. They provide resources for locating substance abuse treatment and opioid services throughout the state, including in Pinal County.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 602-417-4000 (General), 602-586-1841 or 1-800-624-3879 (Mercy Care Member Services for Pinal County) | Email: Contact through website | Address: 801 E. Jefferson, Phoenix, AZ 85034
stateWideResources.phone: 602-417-4000 (General), 602-586-1841 or 1-800-624-3879 (Mercy Care Member Services for Pinal County)
stateWideResources.eligibility: Arizona residents; some services available regardless of insurance status
stateWideResources.hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM; Crisis services available 24/7

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security (DES) Homeless Services
stateWideResources.description: The DES Homeless Coordination Office contracts with nonprofit and local government entities to provide rapid rehousing, emergency shelter, homeless prevention, and street outreach services throughout Arizona, including Jerome.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Veterans' Services (ADVS)
stateWideResources.description: State-funded agency committed to serving Arizona veterans, service members, and their families by ensuring they receive high-quality services.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Arizona veterans, service members, and their families

stateWideResources.name: Teen Lifeline
stateWideResources.description: Crisis line for teenagers where callers can talk to trained peer counselors about any problem or issue.
stateWideResources.hours: 3pm-9pm: Peer counselors; Other hours: Adult counselors

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security - Homeless Services
stateWideResources.description: The DES Homeless Coordination Office contracts with not for profit and local government entities to provide homeless services throughout Arizona, including Cordes Lakes. Services include Rapid Rehousing, Emergency Shelter, Homeless Prevention, and Street Outreach.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 211 | Address: Statewide service covering Cordes Lakes, AZ
stateWideResources.address: Statewide service covering Cordes Lakes, AZ
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness or at risk of becoming homeless
stateWideResources.hours: Varies by program, call 211 for information

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security
stateWideResources.description: The Arizona Department of Economic Security provides various support services for people with disabilities, seniors, and low-income families in Dewey-Humboldt. Their AZ Links program serves as Arizona's Aging and Disability Resource Center.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 844-770-9500 | Address: 1789 W. Jefferson, Phoenix, AZ 85007
stateWideResources.eligibility: Arizona residents with disabilities, seniors, and low-income families

countyWideResources.name: Stepping Stones Agencies
countyWideResources.description: Since 1980, Stepping Stones Agencies has provided 24/7/365 advocacy services, including safe shelter, to adults and children affected by domestic violence, sexual assault, and other forms of victimization in West Yavapai County, Arizona.
countyWideResources.eligibility: Adults and children affected by domestic violence, sexual assault, and other forms of victimization

countyWideResources.name: Prism Network
countyWideResources.description: Provides support and resources for the LGBTQ+ and underserved populations in Yavapai County and Northern Arizona.

countyWideResources.name: BeConnected
countyWideResources.description: Connects Arizona service members, veterans, families & helpers to information, support, and resources throughout Yavapai County.
countyWideResources.eligibility: Veterans, service members, and their families

countyWideResources.name: Northern Arizona Council of Governments (NACOG)
countyWideResources.description: Offers rent assistance and senior services to Yavapai County residents including Clarkdale

countyWideResources.name: Northern Arizona Council of Governments (NACOG)
countyWideResources.description: NACOG provides services for seniors, disabled individuals, and low-income families in Northern Arizona, including Cordes Lakes. Their Area Agency on Aging offers Medicare benefits counseling, health and wellness programs, and other support services.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 1-877-521-3500 | Address: Regional service covering Yavapai County including Cordes Lakes, AZ
countyWideResources.address: Regional service covering Yavapai County including Cordes Lakes, AZ
countyWideResources.eligibility: Seniors, disabled individuals, and low-income residents of Northern Arizona
countyWideResources.hours: Monday-Friday, business hours (call for specific times)

countyWideResources.name: Prism Network
countyWideResources.description: A non-partisan organization that provides an umbrella of support to members, family, friends, and allies of the LGBTQ+ community in Northern Arizona, including Cordes Lakes. They offer referrals to inclusive services, support, activities, and community connections.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 928-583-3514 | Address: 303 E. Gurley St., #413, Prescott, AZ 86301
countyWideResources.eligibility: LGBTQ+ individuals and their families, friends, and allies in Northern Arizona

countyWideResources.name: Substance Abuse Treatment Centers
countyWideResources.description: Substance abuse treatment centers in Cordes Lakes provide essential services for individuals seeking recovery from addiction. They offer personalized care with flexible inpatient and outpatient options, utilizing evidence-based therapies and holistic approaches.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 877-862-0074 | Email: info@substance-abuse-centers.com | Address: Serving Cordes Lakes, AZ 86333
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals seeking recovery from substance abuse and addiction

countyWideResources.name: Catholic Charities - Cottonwood Office
countyWideResources.description: Catholic Charities provides support services for individuals experiencing homelessness in Cottonwood. They offer case management, resources, local connections, and help creating plans to find permanent housing solutions.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 928-634-4254 | Address: 736 N. Main St, Cottonwood, AZ 86326
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness

countyWideResources.name: Veterans Therapists in Dewey
countyWideResources.description: A network of licensed professional counselors and therapists in Dewey-Humboldt who specialize in serving veterans and military personnel. These therapists offer trauma-informed care, PTSD treatment, and other mental health services specifically tailored to veterans' needs.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: Various (see individual therapist listings) | Address: Various locations in Dewey-Humboldt, AZ
countyWideResources.eligibility: Veterans, military personnel, and their families

localResources.name: The Trevor Project
localResources.description: National organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to LGBTQ young people under 25.

localResources.name: Bagdad Community Food Bank
localResources.description: Local food bank providing food assistance to Bagdad residents in need.

localResources.name: Foothills Caring Corp
localResources.description: Partners with Foothills Food Bank to provide home delivery of food baskets to seniors who have transportation challenges in the Black Canyon City area.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: Serves Black Canyon City area

localResources.name: Foothills Food Bank & Resource Center
localResources.description: Provides food assistance and resource connections to residents in Black Canyon City and surrounding areas, offering fresh food, household supplies, and limited financial support.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: 34550 S Old Black Canyon Hwy, Black Canyon City, AZ 85324
localResources.address: 34550 S Old Black Canyon Hwy, Black Canyon City, AZ 85324
localResources.eligibility: No proof of income or citizenship required
localResources.hours: Tue 9:00 AM-12:00 PM, Wed 3:00 PM-6:00 PM, Thu 9:00 AM-12:00 PM

localResources.name: Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW) Post 1796
localResources.description: Local VFW post serving veterans in the Black Canyon City area, providing support services, community engagement, and camaraderie for veterans.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: 34801 S Velda Rose Rd, Black Canyon City, AZ 85324
localResources.address: 34801 S Velda Rose Rd, Black Canyon City, AZ 85324

localResources.name: Manzanita Outreach / Mobile Food Pantry
localResources.description: Provides emergency food assistance to residents in Clarkdale and surrounding areas through a mobile food pantry program.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: Saint Thomas Episcopal Church, 889 1st South Street Clarkdale, AZ 86324
localResources.address: Saint Thomas Episcopal Church, 889 1st South Street Clarkdale, AZ 86324
localResources.hours: Second and Fourth Tuesdays of each month 2 pm to 4 pm

localResources.name: Clarkdale Parks and Recreation Youth Advisor
localResources.description: Program for teens in Clarkdale to make a difference in their community
localResources.contactInfo: Address: Town of Clarkdale, Clarkdale, AZ 86324
localResources.eligibility: Teens who live in Clarkdale between the ages of 14-17

localResources.name: Congress Senior Citizens, Inc.
localResources.description: Local organization providing support services to seniors in Congress

localResources.name: Old Town Mission - Homeless Resource Center
localResources.description: The Homeless Resource Center at Old Town Mission provides essential services for homeless individuals and families in Cottonwood. They offer showers, meals, survival supplies, and a safe, supportive environment to help people move towards stability and self-sufficiency.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: 928-634-7869 | Address: 116 E Pinal St, Cottonwood, AZ 86326
localResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness

localResources.name: Verde Valley Sanctuary
localResources.description: The Verde Valley Sanctuary offers a safe haven for victims of family violence and sexual assault in Cottonwood and the Verde Valley area. They provide emergency shelter, community outreach, advocacy services, and a 24-hour crisis hotline.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: 928-634-2511 | Address: 601 W. Mingus Ave, Cottonwood, AZ 86325
localResources.eligibility: Victims of domestic violence and sexual assault, and their children
localResources.hours: 24/7 Hotline: 928-634-2511 or 1-800-930-7233; Office: Monday-Friday (call for specific hours)

localResources.name: Verde Valley Homeless Coalition
localResources.description: The Verde Valley Homeless Coalition provides services for homeless individuals in Cottonwood and the Verde Valley area. They operate a day use center and emergency overnight shelter, offering support and resources to help individuals experiencing homelessness.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: 928-641-4298 | Email: info@verdevalleyhomelesscoalition.com | Address: 654 N. Main Street, Cottonwood, AZ
localResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness in the Verde Valley area
localResources.hours: Call for current hours of operation
